buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Implement BACnet integration for all HVAC equipment
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Unified control system will improve operational efficiency and enable advanced scheduling and monitoring
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: 10-15% reduction in energy usage through optimized control
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Ensure all equipment has BACnet compatibility and coordinate with building automation contractor

buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Add variable frequency drives (VFDs) to all applicable fan motors
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: VFDs allow for modulation of fan speed based on demand, reducing energy consumption during partial load conditions
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Specify VFDs compatible with motor sizes and control system

buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Consider increasing MERV rating of filters
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Higher MERV rating filters improve indoor air quality by capturing smaller particulates
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Improved indoor air quality and potential reduction in airborne contaminants
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Verify equipment compatibility with higher pressure drop of improved filters

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Ensuring minimal duct leakage improves system efficiency and reduces energy waste
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Specify duct leakage testing in accordance with SMACNA standards

buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Consider adding UV-C lamps in air handlers
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: UV-C technology can reduce microbial growth on coils and improve indoor air quality
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Reduced maintenance costs and improved indoor air quality
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Add UV-C lamps to air handling units, particularly the DOAS and rooftop units
